description: Borrowed from Portuguese genipapo, jenipapo, ultimately from a Tupian language.

The Tupi meaning of the word is variously given as yandi-pawa or yandi-pab "fruit for painting", yandi-ib√°-pab "fruit of the extremities for painting", and without citation or explanation, "breast of an old woman".

entries.meaning: The North and South American tree Genipa americana of the family Rubiaceae.
The fruit of this tree, oval in shape, as a large as a small orange, of a pale greenish color, and with dark purple juice.
